name: Nux
description: You are NUX, sole survivor of the Nexon warrior tribe. The evil Silthax has invaded your home world of Nexolus, devoured your fellow Nexons and stolen the sacred power crystals from your village.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: Pentium® or AMD® 1.3 GHz Memory: 128 MB RAM Graphics: 32MB 3D Video Card

reviews.review_text: The good: The unqiue *clay* ghraphics. The bad: this game is completly unstable. Even worse than Platypus 2. Get Platypus instead.

Just a pile of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. When you idle the game and ALT+TABed , you cannot move the mouse on normal Windows screen. As the Main Menu shows a High Score board when you're away from keyboard , you will realize this game is designed for Arcade.
Pros: -Lovely art...and maybe good sound.  Cons: -Horrible controls. You can only use the mouse. -♥♥♥♥♥♥ menu screen and a fixed 800x600 resolution.  Overall, lazy game-making.  Thanks for the cards.

This game is not horribly as the reviews makes it seems to be. Most of the people who complain is about the mouse lock, that happens when you alt+tab the game. (Even though they are too lazy to search for a solution to this, since you just have to open the steam overlay and alt+tab).  This game has some nice aspects to it. Although too easy in the first level, it is kinda relaxing, the music is good (until it repeats), the play dough makes the game looks really cool. It is a very easy shmup at first.  And then it turns itself into a bad game. The descend into planet level is pretty bad and hard to control, you can't really move that well and it makes the game really difficult and precise, since you need to play it very slow to reach the places. Any touch in anything and your ship explodes.  That was a poor decision of a game and because of that I don't really find the game atractive at all. This one kind of level can spoil every other thing of the game. But, it is really not that bad, it should deserve at least a bit better rank. Yet, I can't recommend it, even in a sale.

[ENG] No... just no. Like Platypus, this game is very badly done. It looks a bit more interesting than Platypus but it's still a mess. The elements on the backgrounds are very confusing, you can't recognize if some elements are enemies or just background things (at least at the first level, i'm not brave enough to play this game seriously). Plus all the same negative aspects in Platypus. And finally, can't even leave the game to idle because the mouse won't move when you minimized the game :D  [ITA] No... ma proprio no. Come Platypus, anche questo gioco è veramente un disastro. Magari sembra un pò più interessante ma è comunque un disastro. Gli elementi grafici di sfondo si confondono, non si riesce nemmeno a capire se i nemici siano veri o no (almeno al primo livello, non sono abbastanza coraggioso da voler giocare seriamente questo obbrobrio). Ovviamente tutto questo si somma agli stessi aspetti negativi presenti anche in Platypus. E per finire, non si può nemmeno lasciare il gioco in background perchè il mouse non si può muovere :D

Doesn't run. Simple as that. Forces full-screen, locking mouse, and preventing any movement once the game loads. Alt-tab forces the mouse to lock in a corner of the monitor, preventing Task Manager use.

Nux is a decent game with a various gameplay (platform, shooter and physics game).  PROS:  - The graphics is very cool. - Nice concept idea. - Old school. - Steam trading cards.  CONS:  - Poor of extra (no extra mode, no achievement). - Too short. - Some level is boring.  Vote: 6+

The in-game sound only comes out of one speaker. Plus you can't change any of the graphics settings. The text is also garbled in some areas of the game.  Get the trading cards and make a quick retreat!
